questions.question: The core losses in a transformer depend primarily on:
questions.explanation: Core losses (hysteresis + eddy current) depend on supply voltage and frequency, not load current.

questions.explanation: The commutator converts alternating current (AC) generated in the armature to direct current (DC).

questions.explanation: Synchronous motors can operate at leading/lagging PF by adjusting field excitation.

questions.question: The efficiency of a transformer is maximum when:
questions.explanation: Efficiency is maximized when variable losses (copper) equal fixed losses (iron).

questions.explanation: Armature reaction distorts the main flux (cross-magnetization) and weakens it (demagnetization).

questions.explanation: Crawling is caused by **space harmonics (7th or 5th)** in the stator MMF, making the motor 'crawl' at sub-synchronous speeds.
